alert.note: Alert for Hughes; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 7:27AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Pontotoc and central Hughes Counties through 800 AM CST... At 727 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Wetumka to 3 miles southeast of Allen. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dustin, Calvin, Stuart, Lamar, Gerty, Horntown and Atwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
